description.narrative: Reduce TB and HIV burden in Kyrgyzstan aimed to reduce TB and HIV burden in Kyrgyzstan through universal access to timely and quality HIV and TB diagnosis and treatment.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: CS-1(M): Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy KP-1a(M): Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services KP-1c(M): Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services KP-1d(M): Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services KP-5: Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months TB/HIV-3.1: Percentage of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings PMTCT-2.1: Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received ART during pregnancy MDR TB-2(M): Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified MDR TB-3(M): Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment MDR TB-7: Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug

comment.narrative: CS-1(M): Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy 32.9% (2668/8100) KP-1a(M): Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 32.2% (3765/11692) KP-1c(M): Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 57% (4050/7103) KP-1d(M): Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 58.7% (14682/25000) KP-5: Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months 51% (123/241) TB/HIV-3.1: Percentage of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings 95.6% (2735/2861) PMTCT-2.1: Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received ART during pregnancy 96.9% (123/127) MDR TB-2(M): Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified 1236 MDR TB-3(M): Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment 1216 MDR TB-7: Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug 44.6% (415/930)

CS-1(M): Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy 55.2% (5123/9276) KP-1a(M): Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 72.7% (8503/11692) KP-1c(M): Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 72.5% (5148/7103) KP-1d(M): Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 67.5% (16875/25000) KP-5: Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months 62.7% (160/255) TB/HIV-3.1: Percentage of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings 95% MDR TB-2(M): Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified 720 MDR TB-3(M): Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment 720

CS-1(M): Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy 81% (7587/8500) KP-1a(M): Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 93.6% (10940/11692) KP-1c(M): Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 80% (5680/7103) KP-1d(M): Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 75% (18750/25000) KP-5: Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months 70% TB/HIV-3.1: Percentage of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings 95% MDR TB-2(M): Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified 740 MDR TB-3(M): Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment 740 MDR TB-7: Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug 75%

Results presented are as of 30 June 2020 and achievement is strongly affected by COVID-19 related crisis. End year results will be available and updated in Feb 2021. CS-1(M): Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy 43,28% (4328/10000) – comm. Denominator: Estimated number of all adults and children living with HIV for 2019 is 10, 000 according to the UNAIDS/SPECTRUM data (pls. refer to the link:http://aidsinfo.unaids.org/).However, total 93% of PLHIV who were accessible to the HIV medical care programme were receiving ART (4328/4632). KP-1a(M): Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 85.9% (10039/11692) KP-1c(M): Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 49% (3481/7103) KP-1d(M): Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 65% (16328/25000) KP-5: Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months 56% TB/HIV-3.1: Percentage of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings 97.4% MDR TB-2(M): Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified 733 MDR TB-3(M): Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment 606 MDR TB-7: Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug 68.9%
